newsitem.title: SPAIN: Chirac says unbalanced NATO would not survive.
newsitem.headline: Chirac says unbalanced NATO would not survive.

text.p: French President Jacques Chirac, in a clear warning to the United States, told NATO leaders on Tuesday their alliance would not survive if the balance of power between Americans and Europeans was not changed in favour of Europe, his spokeswoman said.

Spokeswoman Catherine Colonna quoted Chirac as telling a closed-door NATO summit: "Since the reasons behind the creation of the alliance have largely disappeared, our alliance would not durably survive with an unbalanced Euro-American relationship, both in the sharing of power in the military structure and in the political decision-making process."

The French leader expressed frustration that there had not been more progress in reforming NATO's structures, with a real political control over military activities and a real place for a European defence identity in the command structure.
U.S. President Bill Clinton called on Monday for new negotiations between NATO and France with the aim of bringing Paris into the integrated command by the end of the year.
But he again rejected Chirac's key demand that Washington hand over NATO's southern command, which controls the Mediterranean, to a European.
